description: The user queue discard alarm trap.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserQueueStatDiscardAlarmTrap HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserFrameId i 9999 HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserSlotId i 9999 HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserPortId i 9999 HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserQueueStatPerDropPackets C 9999

description: The ID of the frame which the alarm device located.
variables.name: HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserFrameId

description: The ID of the slot on which the alarmed HQoS user applied.
variables.name: HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserSlotId

description: The ID of port on which the alarmed HQoS user applied.
variables.name: HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserPortId

description: The number of discarded packets in a certain period.
variables.name: HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserQueueStatPerDropPackets

description: The user apply pir fail alarm trap.

event.Summary: Failed to apply PIR to user queue

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserQueueApplyPirFailAlarmTrap ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalIndex i 9999 ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserQueueApplyFailDirection i 1

description: The index for this entry.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalIndex

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: The direction of alarmed HQoS which user applied.
variables.name: HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserQueueApplyFailDirection

description: The user apply pir sucess alarm trap.

event.Summary: PIR successfully applied to user queue

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserQueueApplyPirSucessAlarmTrap ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalIndex i 9999 ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserQueueApplyFailDirection i 1

If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise

and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: The direction of alarmed HQoS which user applied.
variables.name: HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserQueueApplyFailDirection

description: The user-queue apply alarm trap.
This object indicates the name of the interface which apply user-queue.
The object is a string of 1 to 31 characters.
variables.name: HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosUserQueueApplyAlarmIfNetName

description: The PortQueue Stat Discard alarm trap.

event.Summary: Port queue ($v2) discard statistic ($v3) alarm triggered

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosPortQueueStatDiscardAlarmTrap HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosPortQueueInterfaceTrap s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosPortQueueCosValueTrap i 1 HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosPortQueueDiscardTypeTrap i 1 HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosPortQueueDiscardValueTrap s EXAMPLE

description: The value of this object identifies the name of an interface.
variables.name: HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosPortQueueInterfaceTrap

description: The value of this object identifies the queue type.
The value can be any of the following:
PORTQUEUEBE(1)
PORTQUEUEAF1(2)
PORTQUEUEAF2(3)
PORTQUEUEAF3(4)
PORTQUEUEAF4(5)
PORTQUEUEEF(6)
PORTQUEUECS6(7)
PORTQUEUECS7(8)
variables.name: HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosPortQueueCosValueTrap

description: The value of this object identifies the discard type.
The value can be any of the following:
DISCARD-PACKET(1),
DISCARD-BYTE(2),
DISCARD-PACKET-RATIO(3)
variables.name: HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosPortQueueDiscardTypeTrap

description: This object indicates the discard value.
variables.name: HUAWEI-HQOS-MIB::hwhqosPortQueueDiscardValueTrap

description: The PortQueue Stat Discard Cancel alarm trap.

event.Summary: Port queue ($v2) discard statistic ($v3) alarm cancelled
